question_sentence: Despite polls putting the far-right National Rally in the lead, which alliance came out on top in France's parliamentary election?
The New York Times revealed a neurologist specialising in which disease visited the White House eight times in eight months?
Four Nasa astronauts have completed a year living in Dune Alpha, a man-made simulation of conditions in what setting?
Which Italian volcanoes erupted within a day of each other?
The first trailer for "Gladiator II" featured a particularly eye-catching sequence involving what animal?
Which referee was controversially assigned to officiate England's Euro 2024 semi-final with the Netherlands?
On Tuesday, it was revealed that the US prevented a court hearing from taking place on which UK island territory?
World leaders met for Nato's 75th anniversary summit in which US city?
How many former cabinet ministers had to be replaced in Rishi Sunak’s shadow cabinet after losing their seats in the general election?
Nasa's Starliner capsule has delayed its return to Earth for what reason?
A powerful storm this week strengthened into the Atlantic’s earliest Category 5 hurricane on record. What was its name?
evidence: Recovery and cleanup efforts are underway after Beryl slammed into southern Texas on Monday. It is the earliest Category 5 hurricane on record — one of several milestones no other early July hurricane has reached.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden hosted global leaders in Washington, DC, this week for which annual gathering?
evidence: President Biden hosted global allies at the annual NATO summit, a gathering designed to show a united front on key issues. The world leaders jointly affirmed that “Ukraine’s future is in NATO” and its path is “irreversible” as they pledged long-term support to Kyiv.

question_sentence: Which rare disease was confirmed in a person in Colorado this week, alarming local health officials?
evidence: A case of plague has been confirmed in a person in Pueblo County, Colorado. Although it is best known for “The Black Death,” an outbreak that killed millions of Europeans during the Middle Ages, the bacteria circulates naturally among wild rodents and rarely infects humans today, according to the CDC.

question_sentence: Which country plunged into political limbo this week after no party reached an absolute majority in its snap parliamentary election?
evidence: The results from the French election took the country by surprise. The left-wing alliance came in first with 182 seats and the far-right trailed in third place — a shocking reversal of the first-round results.

question_sentence: As the Olympics approach, which river in Europe could host some of the Games’ swimming events despite pollution concerns?
evidence: Weeks before the Olympic Games are set to begin in Paris, the River Seine is still not safe for swimming on most days due to high levels of E. Coli bacteria in the water, according to official data.

question_sentence: Which large retailer announced it will stop accepting personal checks as a form of payment?
evidence: Target will stop accepting checks from customers this month, citing “extremely low volumes” of people who use the rare form of payment.

question_sentence: Which city saw thousands of protesters take to the streets to demonstrate against mass tourism?
evidence: Protesters in Barcelona squirted visitors with water pistols as part of a demonstration against mass tourism. Local officials say the impacts of mass tourism have increased prices and put pressure on public services.

question_sentence: What is the deadliest form of severe weather in the US?
evidence: Extreme heat is by far the deadliest form of severe weather, killing on average twice as many people a year as tornadoes and hurricanes combined. Heat is suspected in the deaths of at least 37 people in the US this month as many cities endure their hottest summers on record.

question_sentence: Which university received a $1 billion gift to make medical school free for most of its students?
evidence: Bloomberg Philanthropies is gifting $1 billion to make medical school free for the majority of students at Johns Hopkins University, joining other high-profile donors who have contributed to tuition-free medical schools across the country.

question_sentence: Caesar salad is celebrating its 100th anniversary. Where was the beloved dish invented?
evidence: Caesar salad was invented in Tijuana, Mexico, in 1924. Meet the grandson of its inventor, Alex Cardini, who has preserved the original recipe!

question_sentence: What is one of the significant changes in Delaware’s child care reform according to the story?
choices: All child care facilities in Delaware are now required to have an electronic licensing record system and registry of child care professionals.
Senate Bill 295, which requires prospective child care professionals with prior experience to provide “service letters” to health care and child care facilities before they can be hired, was passed.
The salary schedule for child care licensing specialists, supervisors, and administrators was eliminated.
All child care facilities in Delaware are now required to have a professional registry of child care professionals.

question_sentence: What was the outcome of the Christina School Board meeting regarding Superintendent Dan Shelton?
choices: Dan Shelton was promoted to a higher position.
Dan Shelton was given a raise in his salary.
Dan Shelton was placed on administrative leave
Dan Shelton was given a vote of confidence by the board.

question_sentence: Who are the four inductees into the Delaware Women’s Hall of Fame for 2024?
choices: Raye Jones Avery, Julissa Coriano, Anna Marie Leo, Melissa Zebley
Anitra Johnson, John Carney, Raye Jones Avery, Julissa Coriano
John Carney, Anitra Johnson, Melissa Zebley, Anna Marie Leo
Julissa Coriano, Anna Marie Leo, Melissa Zebley, Anitra Johnson

question_sentence: According to a recent report, which of the following factors contributed to the decrease in gun sales in Delaware?
choices: Increase in public opinion favoring gun control
Passage of legislation that bans high-capacity magazines and certain semi-automatic weapons
Mandates for handgun training before purchasing firearms

question_sentence: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a cool place to go with kids during the heat wave in Delaware?
What services does Bay Venture Outfitters offer at their new location in Frankford?
choices: Kayak and paddleboard rentals, large group reservations, and waterfront paddlesport storage

question_sentence: The political career of Bill Roth did not end on a high note. In 2000, the five-time incumbent lost the U.S. Senate seat that he had held since 1971 to his opponent. Who was it?
What discovery did the University of Delaware researchers make about the kissing bug found in New Castle County in July 2023?
choices: The bug was infected with a parasite that causes a sometimes lethal disease
The bug was a new species previously unknown to science
The bug was actually a harmless beetle

question_sentence: What is the primary focus of Greg Gober’s work at the Gettysburg battlefield?
choices: He is working to identify and protect the trees that were present during the battle.
He is leading tours about the history of the Gettysburg battlefield.
He is researching the strategies used in the battle.
He is restoring historical monuments on the battlefield.

question_sentence: In the Delaware Handicap, jockey Jose Ortiz rode which horse to victory, tying a record in the process?
